mn74:2.4: BB has “is acceptable to me”. But this doesn’t quite work. As we see below, the problem is with dogmatic insistence. But to say something is “acceptable” is merely to not rule it out. What’s meant here is closer to the English idea of “belief”.
mn74:2.7: The same idion is found at AN 4.24. Here, I feel the negative form is more natural and comprehensible English.
mn74:9.2: The meaning of kayanvayata is shown in MN 36
